oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-07-13 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from July 13, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Hawkshaw Hawkins (host/performer), guest performers the Everly Brothers, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, June Carter, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. On this show Archie Bleyer, president of Cadence Records, presents the Everly Brothers with a gold record for 'Bye Bye Love', for surpassing 1,000,000 sales. It is announced that this is the 927th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Hawkshaw Hawkins; Rod Brasfield; Everly Brothers; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Hawkshaw Hawkins -- I'll Be Gone (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces the Everly Brothers -- Bye Bye Love (Everly Brothers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Tommy Jackson -- Old Joe Clark (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins talks -- Just A Closer Walk With Thee (Hawkshaw Hawkins) -- Hawkshaw Hawkins introduces Chet Atkins -- Oh By Jingo! (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; United States.
